page.title: 11HARMBY AREA - COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: THERE ARE THREE PUBLICATIONS AIMED AT THIS AREA.THEY ARE THE DARLINGTON AND STOCKTON TIMES, THE NORTH YORKSHIRE NEWS AND THE DALESMAN MAGAZINE. THERE IS NO PUBLIC LIBRARY,A MOBILE LIBRARY COMES EVERY FORTNIGHT.IT IS VERY POPULAR. PEOPLE HAVE THE USUAL MEANS OF COMMUNICATIONS IE.THE POSTAL SERVICE AND THE TELEPHONE.MOST PEOPLE HAVE TELEPHONES.OR USE PUBLIC TELEPHONES IN SPENNITHORNE AND HARMBY. THE MAIL IS COLLECTED TWICE A DAY.A POSTMAN DELIVERS ONCE A DAY IN A VAN. THE AREA IS BADLY SERVED BY BUSES AND TRAINS.THERE ARE NO REGULAR PASSENGER TRAINS.THE RAILWAY LINE IS USED ONLY TWICE DAILY BY A FREIGHT TRAIN GOING AS FAR AS REDMIRE QUARRY. THERE ARE ONLY THREE DAILY BUSES THEY TRAVEL FROM NORTHALLERTON TO LEYBURN VIA SPENNITHORNE AND HARMBY.
